tr.td: 2013 right ulnar nerve anterior transposition with wound dehiscence, carpal tunnel release and revision, IF and MF TFR with Dr Strapko 2023-01-17 left OCTR and MF TFR with Dr Roman right medial epicondylitis, left small finger trigger finger

2013 right ulnar nerve anterior transposition with wound dehiscence, carpal tunnel release and revision, IF and MF TFR with Dr Strapko
2023-01-17 left OCTR and MF TFR with Dr Roman
right medial epicondylitis, left small finger trigger finger

td.content: Patient was evaluated and treated for many bilateral upper extremity complaints. He had multiple surgeries on his bilateral upper extremities in the past. Today his right medial epicondylitis is bothering him. I have given him prescription for occupational therapy for this. He does have some ring finger and small finger numbness at times, but he has undergone 2 ulnar nerve surgeries on this side already one of them being an anterior transposition. We will not undergo an EMG or further surgical options on the side at this time. On the left side he has a small ring finger trigger finger which I have injected with cortisone today. He also has pillar pain after having an open carpal tunnel release and scar sensitivity at over the middle finger trigger finger release surgical site. I have given him prescription for occupational therapy for these. He will return to see me as needed.

tr.td: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome; Ulnar Nerve Entrapment at Elbow; Acquired Trigger Finger

tr.td: Patient is here for: new problem. Hand Dominance Right. location:JHnkMjQNp, Location Hand. Duration: many years. Quality: pain, numbness/tingling 4,5 Fingers, stiffness, frequent. Timing: gradual. Context: atraumatic. Severity: moderate. Aggravating Factors: exercise, computer use, cold weather, driving. Patient Feeling: same. Associated Symptoms: radiating to fourth/fifth. Previous Surgery: surgical procedure:; 2013 right ulnar nerve anterior transposition with wound dehiscence, carpal tunnel release and revision, IF and MF TFR with Dr Strapko 2023-01-17 left OCTR and MF TFR with Dr Roman. Prior Imaging: EMG. Previous Aspiration: none. Previous Injections: none. Previous OT/PT: none
Constitutional: no fever, no night sweats, no significant weight gain, no significant weight loss, no chills
Cardiovascular: no chest pain, no shortness of breath when walking
Gastrointestinal: no vomiting, normal appetite, no diarrhea, no constipation, no nausea
Neurologic: no loss of consciousness, no seizures, no headache
General Appearance: healthy-appearing, normal body habitus, NAD. Orientation: oriented to person, oriented to place, oriented to time. Mood and Affect: active and alert, normal mood, normal affect

Arterial Pulses Right: radial normal. Arterial Pulses Left: radial normal. Edema Right: none. Edema Left: none. Varicosities Right: no varicosities, capillary refill test normal. Varicosities Left: no varicosities, capillary refill test normal
Right Upper Extremity: normal. Left Upper Extremity: normal, scar length cm, well healed; OCTR scar and MF trigger finger release scar sensitivity

Inspection Right: normal carrying angle, no deformity, no induration, no redness, no swelling, no warmth, no atrophy. Inspection Left: normal carrying angle, no deformity, no induration, no redness, no swelling, no warmth, no atrophy. Bony Palpation Right: no tenderness of the lateral epicondyle, no tenderness of the olecranon, no tenderness of the biceps insertion, no tenderness of the radiocapitellar, tenderness of the medial epicondyle. Bony Palpation Left: no tenderness of the medial epicondyle, no tenderness of the lateral epicondyle, no tenderness of the olecranon, no tenderness of the biceps insertion, no tenderness of the radiocapitellar. Soft Tissue Palpation Right: no tenderness of the ulnar nerve, no ulna nerve subluxation, no tenderness of the pronator teres, no tenderness of the brachioradialis, no tenderness of the lateral ulnar collateral ligament, no tenderness of the medial collateral ligament, no tenderness of the extensor carpi radialis brevis, no tenderness of the extensor carpi radialis longus, no tenderness of the antecubital fossa, no high riding biceps muscle, no tenderness of the olecranon bursa, no tenderness of the PIN, no tenderness to triceps tendon, tenderness of the flexor carpi ulnaris, tenderness of the flexor carpi radialis. Soft Tissue Palpation Left: no tenderness of the ulnar nerve, no ulna nerve subluxation, no tenderness of the pronator teres, no tenderness of the flexor carpi ulnaris, no tenderness of the flexor carpi radialis, no tenderness of the brachioradialis, no tenderness of the lateral ulnar collateral ligament, no tenderness of the medial collateral ligament, no tenderness of the extensor carpi radialis brevis, no tenderness of the extensor carpi radialis longus, no tenderness of the antecubital fossa, no high riding biceps muscle, no tenderness of the olecranon bursa, no tenderness of the PIN, no tenderness to triceps tendon, no pain with resisted wrist extension, no pain with resisted long finger extension. Active Range of Motion Right: flexion normal, extension normal, pronation normal, supination normal, Full ROM of elbow, Full ROM of wrist, able to make full composite fist. Active Range of Motion Left: flexion normal, extension normal, pronation normal, supination normal, Full ROM of wrist, Full ROM of elbow, able to make full composite fist. Stability Right: no dislocation, no posterior lateral collateral ligament laxity, no medial collateral ligament laxity. Stability Left: no dislocation, no posterior lateral collateral ligament laxity, no medial collateral ligament laxity

Sensation on the Right: C5 normal, C6 normal, C7 normal, C8 normal, T1 normal, T2 normal, normal ulnar nerve distribution, normal radial nerve distribution, normal median nerve distribution, normal at the dorsal 1st web space, normal distal extremities. Sensation on the Left: C5 normal, C6 normal, C7 normal, C8 normal, T1 normal, T2 normal, C7 normal, normal ulnar nerve distribution, normal radial nerve distribution, normal median nerve distribution, normal at the dorsal 1st web space, normal distal extremities

Inspection Right: full range of motion: right hand, normal attitude, no deformities, no hypothenar atrophy, no interosseous atrophy, no thenar atropy, no swelling, no warmth, no mass, no erythema, no atrophy, no hypothenar atrophy, no interossoei atrophy. Inspection Left: no hypothenar, no tear, full range of motion: left hand, normal attitude, no deformities, no atrophy, no swelling, no warmth, no mass, no erythema, no atrophy. Soft Tissue Palpation Right: no tenderness of the soft tissue. Soft Tissue Palpation Left: no tenderness of the soft tissue. Thumb Right: normal A1 pulley, no subluxation of the CMC joint, no pain with CMC grind test, No tenderness of CMC joint, no tenderness of MCP Joint, no tenderness of IP joint, no tenderness of the first metacarpal, no tenderness on palpation of the thumb proximal phalanx, no tenderness on palpation of the thumb distal phalanx, normal passive range of motion, normal active range of motion. Thumb Left: normal A1 pulley, no subluxation of the CMC joint, no pain with CMC grind test, no tenderness of CMC joint, no tenderness of MCP joint, no tenderness of IP joint, no tenderness of the first metacarpal, no tenderness of the thumb proximal phalanx, no tenderness of the thumb distal phalanx, normal passive range of motion, normal active range of motion. Index Finger Right: normal A1 pulley, no tenderness of the second metacarpal, no tenderness of MCP joint, no tenderness of the PIP joint, no tenderness of the DIP joint, no tenderness of the proximal phalanx, no tenderness of the middle phalanx, no tenderness of the distal phalanx, normal active range of motion, normal passive range of motion. Index Finger Left: normal A1 pulley, no tenderness of the second metacarpal, no tenderness of the MCP joint, no tenderness of the PIP joint, no tenderness of the DIP joint, no tenderness of the proximal phalanx, no tenderness of the middle phalanx, no tenderness of the distal phalanx, normal passive range of motion, normal active range of motion. Middle Finger Right: normal A1 pulley, no tenderness at the third metacarpal, no tenderness of the MCP joint, no tenderness of the PIP joint, no tenderness of the DIP joint, no tenderness of the proximal phalanx, no tenderness of the middle phalanx, no tenderness of the distal phalanx, normal active range of motion, normal passive range of motion. Middle Finger Left: normal A1 pulley, no tenderness of the third metacarpal, no tenderness of the MCP joint, no tenderness of the proximal phalanx, no tenderness of the PIP joint, no tenderness of the dip joint, no tenderness of the middle phalanx, no tenderness of the distal phalanx; stiff middle finger. Ring Finger Right: normal A1 pulley, no tenderness of the fourth metacarpal, no tenderness of the mcp joint, no tenderness of the proximal phalanx, no tenderness of the pip joint, no tenderness of the middle phalanx, no tenderness of the dip joint, no tenderness of the distal phalanx, normal active range of motion, normal passive range of motion. Ring Finger Left: normal A1 pulley, no tenderness of the fourth metacarpal, no tenderness of the mcp joint, no tenderness of the proximal phalanx, no tenderness of the pip joint, no tenderness of the middle phalanx, no tenderness of the dip joint, no tenderness of the distal phalanx, normal active range of motion, normal passive range of motion. Little Finger Right: normal A1 pulley, no tenderness of the fifth metacarpal, no tenderness of the mcp joint, no tenderness of the proximal phalanx, no tenderness of the pip joint, no tenderness of the middle phalanx, no tenderness of the dip joint, no tenderness of the distal phalanx, normal active range of motion, normal passive range of motion. Little Finger Left: no tenderness of the fifth metacarpal, no tenderness of the mcp joint, no tenderness of the proximal phalanx, no tenderness of the pip joint, no tenderness of the middle phalanx, no tenderness of the dip joint, no tenderness of the distal phalanx, normal active range of motion, normal passive range of motion, tenderness at the A1 pulley, palpaple mass at the A1 pulley, triggering at the A1 pulley. Stability Right: no general instability. Stability Left: no general instability
